title: @Riot [Request] NOTICE ME!
body: Most every champion who transforms have one set of emotes for each of their forms (looking at you Nidalee, Elise, Swain etc.) but then you get to Quinn and Valor, who are two individuals in their own right, who are forced to share one set of emotes between the two of them and, to top it all off, they can only be used as Quinn. Valor is missing out, give him emotes.

replies.body: Love how no one has mentioned that Shyvana in dragon form has the same problem and as Shyvana is the dragon not an additional character, she should have taunts in her ultimate form as well. EMOTES FOR THE FIREY BEAST {{champion:102}}

> Love how no one has mentioned that Shyvana in dragon form

That would be because it's ***still Shyvanna***. This discussion is about Valor, an individual champion in his own right ***not*** a secondary form of another champion.

I agree.
Every other transformation champion are individuals.
Quinn and Valor are actually two separate characters in lore. 

Valor should get an emote that somehow begs the question, where is quinn when they tag team?

Personally, I'd like Vault to have separate cooldowns, and only Vault because for the other abilities Valor is doing all the work. Except Skystrike.|

Also Quinn should be the next Sandstorm champion. Desert Eagles are cool.

It's already there why ask?

If you press D and F at the same time when you play Quinn, Valor does a special move.

The champion is called Quinn, not Valor and Quinn.

Also every champion you listed is just that champion themselves, 

So basically Quinn is the champ people get not Valor

Originally it was supposed to be "Quinn and Valor" but was shortened to "Quinn" because of name length issues. Not to mention, Valor has his own champion portrait (Gnar is the only individual champion to have multiple portraits) and is an individual champion **in his own right**, he just happens to fight alongside Quinn.

Not to mention, Valor has his own champion portrait (Gnar is the only individual champion to have multiple portraits) and is an individual champion **in his own right**, he just happens to fight alongside Quinn.

Ok, so you come out with some facts I don't know and correct me. That's fine.

But every time we talk on the boards you downvote me just because you are arrogant enough to believe that I deserve it for not knowing something... and we are not even arguing about it.

> But every time we talk on the boards you downvote me just because you are arrogant enough to believe that I deserve it for not knowing something...

No, I downvote you when I disagree with something you've said, as I do with everyone else. I'm confident we've had more than a few interactions where neither of us has downvoted the other but your attitude to one of our more recent discussions seems to be heavily impacting the way you see our interactions and, quite frankly, I'm starting to find it a little annoying that you're now bringing up that discussion every time you reply to me. You can call me "arrogant" for using the downvote system in a manner it was intended to be used, just know I don't care if you do.
